body: I would recommend not to use `useFieldArray` with drag and drop task, take a look this example with custom register: https://react-hook-form.com/advanced-usage#Workingwithvirtualizedlist
It seems to work fine with uncontrolled components. Its just the Controller component that has this issue when used with Field Array.  How do you use custom register for a Controller component?

> How do you use custom register for a Controller component?

as building your own Field Array, but `register` input inside of `useEffect` so it's like a virtual input.
also, your CSB is broken as well, but it will be tricky to get it working with external D&D libs.

Updated the CSB Link : https://codesandbox.io/s/modern-shape-6v9d6?file=/src/App.js
Damn that's too bad useFieldArray seems so nifty.
I will take a look at it anyhow @FatehAK, but it's an external dependency so it probably won't work nicely.
Thanks for the prompt replies @bluebill1049 I understand. I will look into it further

I think DnD clashes with the Controller components, it works perfectly fine when uncontrolled (when using a simple input component). I've been at this for hours can you help me with the sandbox on this. Thanks

On further investigation, I found that this is isn't a DnD issue at all. There is an issue with the `swap` and `move` methods calling them to swap the fields and then calling getValues() later on button click seems to afffect the Controller components(their key is removed) and then key gets added back on any subsequent field change. 

Please checkout this sandbox: 
https://codesandbox.io/s/magical-meninsky-s0y70?file=/src/Panel.js
I've removed all DnD related code to focus on just that.
To demonstrate please enter values in the two fields and click on `swap`. Then click on `debug` to print the values, you can see that the `Address` key is lost on the 0th element
oh, nice! interesting found I haven't got time to looking into it yet, happy for you to drive the fix too. questions: why it's working for uncontrolled?
Exactly swap/move work fine for uncontrolled inputs. I don't get it either. Can you have a looksie when you got time?
What're the steps to reproduce the issue in your codesandbox above? @FatehAK

1) Enter values in the first text field for both points (1 & 2)
2) Click on the `Swap` CTA
3) Click on `Debug` CTA
4) Check console you can see that the 0th element in the FieldArray `BookingPoints` doesn't have the `Address` key on it
